  |statlabel5=Receiving yards |statvalue5=2,606 |statlabel6=Receiving
  touchdowns |statvalue6=8 |nfl=WIL271115 |pfr=WillRi00 }} 'Errick Lynne
  "Ricky" Williams, Jr.' (born May 21, 1977) is a former American football
  running back who played eleven seasons in the National Football League (NFL)
  and one season in the Canadian Football League (CFL). He played college
  football for the University of Texas, where he was a two-time All-American
  and won the Heisman Trophy. He was drafted by the New Orleans Saints fifth
  overall in the 1999 NFL Draft and spent three seasons with the team before he
  was traded to the Miami Dolphins in 2002. He played for the Dolphins for
  three seasons, and retired for the first time from football in 2004. Due to
  his suspension from the NFL in 2006, he played for the Toronto Argonauts in
  2006. He re-joined the Dolphins in 2007 and played with them until 2010, and
  spent the 2011 season with the Baltimore Ravens.
